settings.field.adjustInterestRatePercent: Adjust interest rate % in repeated bonds

If investment duration is longer that bonds duration, bonds will be repeated. However, offered bonds will likely be different in a few years. If the above option is selected, interest rate of future bonds will be adjusted proportionally to reference rates. For example:
bondsForm.name: Name
bondsForm.interestPeriods.cancellationPo: % of interest earned during this period
Total fee limited to total earned interest
Total fee limited to interest earned during this interest period
charts.calculationMethod.1: Net values are presented (after subtracting investment income tax).
charts.calculationMethod.2: When bonds end, total net amount is reinvested in identical bonds.
charts.calculationMethod.3: Until bonds end, presented values include early cancellation fees.
charts.calculationMethod.4: Monthly inflation and reference rates are calculated with the assumption that they change linearly throughout the year.
Losess due to inflation consuming the invested money are also included
exportImport.save.info: You can save your settings and bonds. They will be automatically loaded when you open this app again. However, this is a local storage - saved data won't be available on other computers/browsers and it will disappear if you clear your localStorage.
exportImport.export.info: You can export your data into a text file.
exportImport.import.info: You can import a previously exported file.
exportImport.share.info: You can share your settings and bonds by sharing an URL.
common.numberArrayInput.info: "Year 0" refers to rate at the moment of purchase of bonds
common.numberArrayInput.presets.label: Preset
